ucdp_ged_sb_best_sum.name: (UCDP) Observed fatalities, state-based conflict, VIEWS-adaptation
ucdp_ged_sb_best_sum.description: VIEWS-adaptation of the UCDP 'best estimate' of fatalities from state-based conflict, aggregated to the VIEWS levels of analysis (see Hegre et al., 2023).

source.dataset: UCDP Georeferenced Events Dataset (GED) Global version 23.1; UCDP Candidate Events Dataset (UCDP Candidate) version 24.0.1 through version 24.0.6
source.citation: Davies et al. 2024. Organized violence 1989-2023, and the prevalence of organized crime groups. Journal of Peace Research 61(4); Sundberg & Melander. 2013. Introducing the UCDP Georeferenced Event Dataset. Journal of Peace Research 50(4); Hegre, Håvard, Mihai Croicu, Kristine Eck, and Stina Högbladh (July 2020). 'Introducing the UCDP Candidate Events Dataset'. Research & Politics.
source.license: Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license (CC BY 4.0)

vdem_v2x_rule.name: (V-Dem) Rule of law index
vdem_v2x_rule.description: Index answering the question 'To what extent are laws transparently, independently, predictably, impartially, and equally enforced, and to what extent do the actions of government officials comply with the law?'

source.dataset: Coppedge et al. 2024. 'V-Dem Country-Year Dataset v14' Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem) Project. https://dx.doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.4774440
source.citation: Coppedge et al. 2022. 'V-Dem Country-Year Dataset v12' Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem) Project. https://dx.doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.4774440; 'Pemstein et al. (2024, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2024:21); Coppedge et al. 2024. 'V-Dem Codebook v14' Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem) Project

vdem_v2x_gender.name: (V-Dem) Women political empowerment index
vdem_v2x_gender.description: Index answering the question 'How politically empowered are women?'

source.dataset: Coppedge et al. 2024. 'V-Dem Country-Year Dataset v14' Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem) Project. https://dx.doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.4774440
source.citation: Sundström, Aksel, Pamela Paxton, Yi-ting Wang and Staffan I. Lindberg. 2015. 'Women’s Political Empowerment: A New Global Index, 1900-2012'. Sundström et al. (2017, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2017:19); Coppedge et al. 2024. 'V-Dem Codebook v14' Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem) Project

vdem_v2x_civlib.name: (V-Dem) Civil liberties index
vdem_v2x_civlib.description: Index answering the question 'To what extent is civil liberty respected?'

source.dataset: Coppedge et al. 2024. 'V-Dem Country-Year Dataset v14' Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem) Project. https://dx.doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.4774440
source.citation: Coppedge et al. 2024. 'V-Dem Country-Year Dataset v14' Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem) Project. https://dx.doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.4774440

vdem_v2xcl_acjst.name: (V-Dem) Access to justice index
vdem_v2xcl_acjst.description: Index answering the question 'Do citizens enjoy secure and effective access to justice?'

source.dataset: Coppedge et al. 2024. 'V-Dem Country-Year Dataset v14' Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem) Project. https://dx.doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.4774440
source.citation: Pemstein et al. (2024, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2024:21); Coppedge et al. 2024. 'V-Dem Codebook v14' Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem) Project

vdem_v2xeg_eqdr.name: (V-Dem) Equal distribution of resources index
vdem_v2xeg_eqdr.description: Index answering the question 'How equal is the distribution of resources?'

vdem_v2x_libdem.description: Index answering the question 'To what extent is the ideal of liberal democracy achieved?'

wb_wdi_ny_gdp_pcap_kd.name: (WB) GDP per capita (constant 2015 US$)
wb_wdi_ny_gdp_pcap_kd.description: GDP per capita is gross domestic product divided by midyear population. GDP is the sum of gross value added by all resident producers in the economy plus any product taxes and minus any subsidies not included in the value of the products. It is calculated without making deductions for depreciation of fabricated assets or for depletion and degradation of natural resources. Data are in constant 2015 U.S. dollars.

source.citation: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files; World Bank, World Development Indicators (2022-12). 'GDP per capita (constant 2015 US$)'. Accessed using the 3rd party app WBGAPI (https://pypi.org/project/wbgapi/) by means of a query of the WDI database (db=2).

wb_wdi_sp_dyn_le00_in.name: (WB) Life expectancy at birth, total (years)
wb_wdi_sp_dyn_le00_in.description: Life expectancy at birth. Indicates the number of years a newborn infant would live if prevailing patterns of mortality at the time of its birth were to stay the same throughout its life.

source.citation: World Bank, World Development Indicators (2022-12). 'Life expectancy at birth, total (years)'. Accessed using the 3rd party app WBGAPI (https://pypi.org/project/wbgapi/) by means of a query of the WDI database (db=2).

wb_wdi_se_prm_nenr.name: (WB) School enrollment, primary (% net)
wb_wdi_se_prm_nenr.description: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.

source.citation: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (http://uis.unesco.org/). Data as of February 2020; World Bank, World Development Indicators (2022-12). 'School enrollment, primary (% net)'. Accessed using the 3rd party app WBGAPI (https://pypi.org/project/wbgapi/) by means of a query of the WDI database (db=2).

wb_wdi_sp_pop_totl.name: (WB) Total population
wb_wdi_sp_pop_totl.description: Total population is based on the de facto definition of population, which counts all residents regardless of legal status or citizenship. The values shown are midyear estimates.

source.citation: (1) United Nations Population Division. World Population Prospects: 2022 Revision. (2) Census reports and other statistical publications from national statistical offices, (3) Eurostat: Demographic Statistics, (4) United Nations Statistical Division. Population and Vital Statistics Reprot (various years), (5) U.S. Census Bureau: International Database, and (6) Secretariat of the Pacific Community: Statistics and Demography Programme; World Bank, World Development Indicators (2022-12). 'Population, total'. Accessed using the 3rd party app WBGAPI (https://pypi.org/project/wbgapi/) by means of a query of the WDI database (db=2).

wb_wdi_sp_dyn_imrt_in.name: (WB) Infant mortality rate per 1,000 live births
wb_wdi_sp_dyn_imrt_in.description: Infant mortality rate is the number of infants dying before reaching one year of age, per 1000 live births in a given year.

source.citation: Estimates developed by the UN Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (UNICEF, WHO, World Bank, UN DESA Population Division) at www.childmortality.org; World Bank, World Development Indicators (2022-12). 'Mortality rate, infant (per 1,000 live births)'. Accessed using the 3rd party app WBGAPI (https://pypi.org/project/wbgapi/) by means of a query of the WDI database (db=2).

visualization.legend: Infant mortality rate per 1,000 live births
